original_title: Usedom: Der freie Blick aufs Meer
overview: For Berliners, the Baltic island of Usedom was once the most luxurious destination for excursions within striking distance of the city. This is where imperial Germanyâ€™s grand health resorts of Bansin, Heringsdorf and Ahlbeck were built. Heinz Brinkmann, who was born in Heringsdorf, traces the eventful history of his island.
title: Usedom: A Clear View of the Sea
